Posts.Content: Hi all, I have just had my results from my first yearly Mammogram and it's states " Did not show anything of concern" So does that make me a Neddie? Or do I need to wait the full 5 years and the all clear? regards Shaz x
Posts.Title: NED?

Posts.Content: No problem x I was told it would be 4 - 6 weeks before rads.
Posts.Title: silly question time !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Ali,  the Rads are to kill off any remaining cancer cells and hopefully stop them coming back.  I had surgery 3 weeks nearly now and in about 3 weeks I should be having Rads too for 3 weeks. Hope that helps Shaz x
Posts.Title: silly question time !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Liz, After my lumpectomy last year, I was given the choice to have chemo as well as radiotherapy.  After the consultant went through the "predict" sheet it said my chances of non-recurrence was 75% + 6% with radiotherapy and 5% with chemo.  I was quite happy with an 81% chance of it not coming back and wasn't willing to go through months and months of chemo along with it's nasty side effects and risks for just 5% more, so I declined and just had the rads instead and anti hormone tabs instead.  It's been a year now and I've had my first follow up Mammogram and received the results today - all clear. It's down to personal choice and you mustn't be made to feel guilty if you decline too.  All the best to you Liz Shaz
Posts.Title: Thinking of turning down chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy, At least you won't forget the day you had surgery, me neither, I had mine on April Fools Day. I'm just glad it wasn't Friday the 13th. I'm due my results on Monday 20th, and then as far as I know it'll be 3 weeks Rads and then Hormone tabs for 5 years+. Hope it all goes well for you Wendy, stay positive and all the best. Shaz x
